abstract.p: Schedule for 38th New York Film Festival (S)

block.p: The 38th New York Film Festival, presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center, opens tonight and closes on Oct. 9. All films are shown at Alice Tully Hall with the exception of the late show tonight, the closing night film and the screenings on Sunday night of ''Body and Soul,'' at Avery Fisher Hall. Several events are planned at the Walter Reade at Lincoln Center. ''Passion and Defiance: Silent Divas of the Italian Cinema,'' a retrospective of 15 films, begins on Sunday and runs through Oct. 6. ''Views From the Avant-Garde,'' a four-part series, is to be shown on Oct. 7 and 8. Tickets are $20 to $55 for ''Body and Soul.'' Tickets to ''Silent Divas'' and ''Avant-Garde'' are $9; $5 for Film Society members; $4.50 for the elderly at weekday matinees. Box office: (212) 875-5600. Many festival screenings are sold out. (Returns may be available.) Tickets: $10 to $55; available at the Tully Hall box office, (212) 875-5050. Unless otherwise noted, the films shown were made this year. Some are scheduled to be released commercially in New York; release dates are noted in this schedule.
''DANCER IN THE DARK'' (Denmark/Sweden/France), directed by Lars von Trier, Tully Hall, 8:15 p.m.; at Fisher Hall, 9 p.m. Opens commercially tomorrow.
